My svelte server is working but it is not reflect the change of typescript file 

### How to reproduce the problem from neovim startup

- Open neovim, open svelte file.
-  import another typescript file to that svelte file
-  go to typescript file and change code and save that file
-  svelte don't understand the update code.

if i quit neovim and reopen that file svelte will know that change .



### Actual behaviour
it don't reflect the change in typesciprt
### Expected behaviour
it need to know the update code.


i check and this issue happen with coc-svelte but it work on vscode.

comment_data.body: I don't think this is an issue with nvim-lspconfig, but an issue with neovim core's implementation. This repo only handles initialization the language server, none of the functionality of the language server client. Unless you can find a specific setting we are not sending to the language server, please file an issue with the neovim core repo.

I'm actually experiencing this issue too. From digging around, it looks like svelte-language-server is setup to handle svelte files (assume the client on runs for `.svelte` files), so it does not monitor changes in `.ts` files. You end up having to restart the LSP if you want to see changes.

It looks like coc-svelte and the VSCode extension handle this client side:

* https://github.com/coc-extensions/coc-svelte/pull/47
* https://github.com/sveltejs/language-tools/blob/a0b01ff7a58e6bedf0bb087b0023d3b6ea7cd0eb/packages/svelte-vscode/src/extension.ts#L275
 

I'm unsure how this would work with a lspconfig setup? Any advice @mjlbach ?

I stepped away from the project and don't actively use neovim anymore.

This could/should probably be changed to a `didChangeWatchedFiles` and filtered server side https://github.com/sveltejs/language-tools/blob/09a2dbdca0ecd25ca2750beaabd305d718b359d1/packages/language-server/src/server.ts#L452-L459, that way it's spec-compliant (I don't see why it should require something off-spec for this).

A file watcher was added to neovim circa 0.9 based on my cursory glance at the commits. Worst case is you could wrap that to send an additional notification. I have no code suggestions for you and will not work on it.
|'m in the same problem! https://github.com/sveltejs/language-tools/issues/1415#issuecomment-1539681042

https://github.com/sveltejs/language-tools/issues/2008#issuecomment-1539788464
Here is my solution
pattern would be better use your project root `root/*.js `.

Hi. I am a maintainer of @sveltejs/language-tools. `onDidChangeTsOrJsFile` is a custom endpoint for syncing in editor file changes. Is the problem with the file watcher not triggering or updates only working when the file is saved?  We have `didChangeWatchedFiles`, but the file watcher config is set in the client.

@jasonlyu123 Not too sure if its an issue with the langauge-server? From a bit of digging around it looks like the VSCode extension handles this client side? So if I add a property in the `.ts` file, the `.svelte` component won't see the new property without a restart of the editor/svelte language server (at the moment). I assume because its not been told to refresh on `js`/`ts` file saves.

The above code does actually seem to solve the issue. I think it replicates what's happening here: https://github.com/sveltejs/language-tools/blob/master/packages/svelte-vscode/src/extension.ts#L312
maybe need  manually set the capability `workspace.didChangeWatchedFiles.dynamicRegistration = true`

@RichGuk Yes, I see that in your previous comment. Do you expect the change to reflect if the file is saved to the file system or if you expect it to work without file save? These are different issues.
@jasonlyu123 I would expect it to work on save, personally.

For 0.9 user try this

```lua
local updated_capabilities = vim.lsp.protocol.make_client_capabilities()
updated_capabilities.workspace.didChangeWatchedFiles.dynamicRegistration = true
```

Unlike Volar, we didn't use dynamicRegistration for file watchers. The file watcher glob is set in clients. We also have a fallback if the client doesn't support `didChangeWatchedFiles`. That means if the client supports `didChangeWatchedFiles` but doesn't configure the watcher glob in the client. Files won't be watched. Since multiple people suddenly have the problem, I'll assume this is because 0.9 added the support, so our fallback isn't used.

And if the watcher works, the `onDidChangeTsOrJsFile` endpoint is only needed if you want changes to reflect without needing to save the file first.

@ryoppippi neovim lsp

> Added preliminary support for the workspace/didChangeWatchedFiles capability to the LSP client to notify servers of file changes on disk. The feature is disabled by default and can be enabled by setting the workspace.didChangeWatchedFiles.dynamicRegistration=true capability.

I forget its true by default


I tried moving the watcher registration to the language server with dynamic registration. It fixed the issue, and the existing client with configs on the client side seems to be working fine. So I think we can fix this on our side. 

@ryoppippi Yes. that method only works for existing files. New files are only checked in file watcher which is what is missing now.

I found a somewhat "silly" solution. You can name your files `.svelte` and set the script tag's `context` attribute to `module` and simply export whatever you what as plain typescript.
